title: Flipped Learning-Based Project Education for Improving Information Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy and experience in information retrieval
context.additional_context: Social studies job competency enhancement program for employees, conducted in smartphone-centric limited technological environments. Applies blended flipped learning (face-to-face/online) and evaluates through team project deliverables

learning_goals: Learners can critically evaluate credible information sources to select materials appropriate for academic or professional contexts.
Learners can complete at least 80% of online pre-learning content (10 videos, 5-7 minutes each) in a flipped learning environment and summarize key concepts.
Learners can produce project reports adhering to information ethics (attribution, misinformation detection) while analyzing social studies topics through PBL activities.

resources: Open-access database for information retrieval practice
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
